monsters.name: Minotaur
monsters.description: Beast-men with bull heads, blazing yellow-orange eyes, usually tribal in the southern hemisphere.

monsters.name: Scarecrow
monsters.description: Animated straw scarecrows created by mad diabolists; still roam Eastern Territory.

monsters.name: Spectre
monsters.description: Wraith-like energy creatures in humanoid form, not ghosts nor flesh beings.

monsters.name: Unicorn
abilities: Only virgin pure of heart may tame
monsters.description: Beautiful horse-like creature with a silver horn and cloven hooves. Sacred defenders of the pure; will only allow a virgin of spotless heart to ride.

monsters.name: Pegasus
abilities: Flight ability (cannot run fast on ground)
monsters.description: Majestic winged horse that soars among storm clouds. Loyal only to honorable riders.

monsters.name: Harpy
abilities: Flight ability (cannot run fast on ground)
Stench 25 ft radius (save vs poison or suffer -2 strike, -3 parry/dodge)
monsters.description: Head/upper body of ugly woman, legs/tail/wings of bird. Hates all good and beautiful.

monsters.name: Chimera
monsters.description: Lion head, goat body, dragon tail. Breathes flame. Common in Yin-Sloth jungles.

monsters.name: Mummy
monsters.description: Animated undead in graveyards, catacombs, dungeons. Created by Men of Magic.

monsters.name: Gryphon
monsters.description: Eagle head and claws, lion body, sweeping wings. Fiercely territorial hunters that swoop on trespassers from great heights.

monsters.name: Ghost
monsters.description: Essences of powerful entities after death. Frustrated, angry, jealous of living.

monsters.name: Werewolf
abilities: Rise again unless head severed, burned, and buried separately
monsters.description: Humanoid by day, wolf by night. Maintains intelligence in animal form and can only be slain permanently by silver or by burning the severed head.

monsters.name: Weretiger
abilities: Rise again unless head severed, burned, and buried separately
monsters.description: Humanoid by day, tiger by night. More powerful than werewolves and just as difficult to kill permanently.

monsters.name: Werepanther
abilities: Rise again unless head severed, burned, and buried separately
monsters.description: Humanoid by day, panther by night. Graceful and stealthy predators that stalk prey even after apparent death.

monsters.name: Werebear
abilities: Rise again unless head severed, burned, and buried separately
monsters.description: Humanoid by day, bear by night. The most powerful of common werebeasts, feared for their resilience and unstoppable rage.

monsters.name: Sphinx
monsters.magicAbilities: All wizard spells levels 1-5 at 6th-level proficiency
monsters.description: Lion body, eagle wings, and a humanoid face. Guardians of forgotten temples who test intruders with wit before unleashing deadly magic.

monsters.name: Green Mold
abilities: At half HP: half speed, -2 all saves
monsters.description: Cursed plant infection. Only remove curse can destroy green mold.

monsters.name: Bug Bear
abilities: Turn invisible (1 minute, once per 3 melees)
Teleport (max 40 ft, once every other melee)
monsters.description: Fur-covered, bear-like people with canine teeth, ~150-200 lbs. Not familiar with armor or iron. Barbaric nomads who are mischievous, cruel, and shy, favoring ambush tactics.

monsters.name: Black Bear
abilities: Can stand upright to intimidate foes
Highly territorial; avoids large groups of humanoids
monsters.description: Black bear found throughout Palladium. Fur value 200 gp, meat 150 gp.

variants.name: Old Kingdom Blackbear
variants.region: Old Kingdom, Land of the Southwinds, Timro, Eastern Territory
variants.description: Large black bears found in the Old Kingdom regions. Skilled climbers.

monsters.name: Brown Bear
abilities: Can stand upright to intimidate foes
Highly territorial; will defend cubs ferociously
monsters.description: Eastern Territory, Northern Wilderness, Lopan. Fur 250 gp, meat 180 gp.

monsters.name: Grizzly Bear
abilities: Can stand upright to intimidate foes
monsters.description: Northern Grizzly. Fur 350 gp, meat 250 gp.

monsters.name: Silver Bear
abilities: Can stand upright to intimidate foes
Territorial but less aggressive than grizzlies
monsters.description: Western Silver Bear. Fur 600 gp, meat 180 gp.

monsters.name: Song Bird
monsters.description: Common songbirds found globally. Value 10-30 gp.

monsters.name: Game Bird
monsters.description: Hunting birds found globally. Meat valued at 15 gp.

monsters.name: Hawk
abilities: Dive attack +2 strike on surprise prey
monsters.description: Bird of prey found globally. Value 50 gp.

monsters.name: Owl
monsters.description: Nocturnal bird found globally. Value 3 gp for magic use.

monsters.name: Vulture
abilities: Immune to most diseases from carrion
monsters.description: Carrion bird found globally. No value.

monsters.name: Booted Eagle
monsters.description: Large eagle found globally. Plumage value 20 gp.

monsters.name: Basilisk
monsters.description: Cunning drake whose gaze turns victims to stone.

monsters.name: Manticore
abilities: Can fire 1-6 tail spikes per melee (maximum 24 per day)
monsters.description: Sadistic predator that toys with prey before unleashing storm of tail spikes.

monsters.name: Wyvern
abilities: Flight ability (cannot run fast on ground)
Poison tail (save vs poison or suffer 2d6 damage per melee for 2d4 rounds)
monsters.description: Brutal sky-raiders feared by caravans and griffon riders.

monsters.name: Troll
monsters.description: Savage brutes that heal from almost any wound unless burned or melted. Rare individuals pursue O.C.C. training alongside monstrous kin.

monsters.name: Ogre
abilities: Average I.Q. 8; raid in tribes of 3-30
monsters.description: Crude, violent marauders who raid for food, coin, and slaves. Some serve as mercenaries or muscle for darker powers.

monsters.name: Sea Serpent
monsters.description: Enormous amphibious predators that smash ships and drown sailors.

monsters.name: Cockatrice

attacks.name: Petrifying Gaze/Breath
attacks.damage: special (standard save vs magic or turn to stone for 1d6 hours)

monsters.description: Predatory dragon-birds that hunt humanoids; rooster's crow paralyzes them.

monsters.name: Seven-Headed Hydra
monsters.size: 25 ft tall, 50 ft long; seven distinct heads
abilities: Often studies wizard spells (levels 1-6 at 5th-level proficiency)
monsters.description: Multi-breath terror whose severed heads return; walking catastrophe.

monsters.name: Thunder Lizard
monsters.size: 20 ft tall, up to 45 ft long; wingless emerald-gold behemoth
monsters.description: Ancient titans steeped in lore and magic; thunder walks with them.

monsters.name: Brownie
monsters.description: Tiny faerie folk known for household magic and trickery.

monsters.name: Pixie
special_abilities: Faerie dust (sleep or glow; small cone)
monsters.description: Winged faerie folk with illusion magic and sleep dust.

monsters.name: Human Wizard
monsters.preferred_weapons: Any, with leanings toward blade weapons and bows
monsters.description: Human wizard capable of casting spells and using weapons.

monsters.name: Elf Ranger
monsters.preferred_weapons: Large swords, short swords, long bows, knives, and blunt weapons
monsters.description: Elven ranger skilled in wilderness survival and archery.

monsters.name: Dwarf Knight
monsters.preferred_weapons: Battle axes, ball and chains, blunt weapons, iron staves, slings
monsters.description: Dwarven knight specializing in heavy weapons and mounted combat.

monsters.name: Algor Giant (Frost Giant)
special_abilities: Frost Breath: 30 ft range, 6 ft wide, 4d6 damage (extra attack)
Can hurl ice boulders for 4d6 damage (range 150 ft)
monsters.description: Massive frost giants of the northern wastes who combine raw strength with a code of hospitality. Though suspicious of warm-blooded folk, they can become stalwart allies against the forces of darkness.

monsters.name: Cyclops
magicAbilities: May channel lightning through melee weapons (adds 2d6-4d6 electrical damage)
monsters.description: One-eyed smiths and raiders famed for forging thunderbolt weapons. Proud and avaricious, they sell their services to the highest bidder.

monsters.name: Jotan
monsters.description: Earth giants who carve fortresses into mountains and mold metal like clay. Brutal warlords who enslave lesser races to expand their cavern empires.

monsters.name: Nimro
notes: Desire to build a giant kingdom
monsters.description: Copper-skinned fire giants who dream of reforging the world in flame. Nimro chieftains wield elemental sorcery and terrorize the Old Kingdom.

monsters.name: Gigantes
special_abilities: Roll four random mutations (night vision, see invisible, impervious to fire, etc.)
20% chance of insanity linked to mutations
monsters.description: Mutant giants warped by ancient sorcery. Each possesses bizarre gifts and a volatile temperament, making them unpredictable foes.

monsters.name: Titan
monsters.magicAbilities: All elemental and wizard spells up to level 6 at 8th-level proficiency
special_abilities: Noble bearing and presence (very high P.B.)
enemies: giant races of darkness (e.g., gigantes, jotan, nimro)
notes: Majestic giants, often leaders and champions against darkness
monsters.description: Noble scions of the Elemental Laws who seek balance in the world. Titans act as mentors to mortal heroes and wield both steel and sorcery with effortless grace.

monsters.name: Human Paladin
monsters.preferred_weapons: Any, with leanings toward blade weapons and bows

monsters.name: Human Knight
monsters.preferred_weapons: Any, with leanings toward blade weapons and bows

monsters.name: Human Ranger
monsters.preferred_weapons: Any, with leanings toward blade weapons and bows

monsters.name: Human Thief
monsters.preferred_weapons: Any, with leanings toward blade weapons and bows

monsters.name: Human Assassin
monsters.preferred_weapons: Any, with leanings toward blade weapons and bows

monsters.name: Human Priest
monsters.preferred_weapons: Any, with leanings toward blade weapons and bows

monsters.name: Human Diabolist
monsters.preferred_weapons: Any, with leanings toward blade weapons and bows

monsters.name: Human Summoner
monsters.preferred_weapons: Any, with leanings toward blade weapons and bows

monsters.name: Human Merchant
monsters.preferred_weapons: Any, with leanings toward blade weapons and bows

monsters.name: Elf Paladin
monsters.preferred_weapons: Large swords, short swords, long bows, knives, and blunt weapons

monsters.name: Elf Long Bowman
monsters.preferred_weapons: Large swords, short swords, long bows, knives, and blunt weapons

monsters.name: Elf Wizard
monsters.preferred_weapons: Large swords, short swords, long bows, knives, and blunt weapons

monsters.name: Elf Knight
monsters.preferred_weapons: Large swords, short swords, long bows, knives, and blunt weapons

monsters.name: Elf Healer
monsters.preferred_weapons: Large swords, short swords, long bows, knives, and blunt weapons

monsters.name: Goblin
abilities: Cowardly unless in groups of 20+, flee if outnumbered
monsters.description: Small, cunning humanoids with dark skin and glowing red eyes. Live in tribes and are known for their cruelty and cowardice. Fear Wolfen and Ogres, and avoid direct fights without numbers.

monsters.name: Hob-Goblin
abilities: Organized into ranked companies with strict discipline
monsters.description: Larger, more organized cousins of goblins. They form military units and are more disciplined fighters, often serving Wolfen or Orc commanders.

monsters.name: Human
abilities: Adaptive: +5% to all skill learn percentages
Build cities and kingdoms across Palladium
Morale driven by culture and leadership
monsters.psionics: Standard (per individual; 10% chance for minor powers)
enemies: Varies by nation (often Orcs, Goblins, Demons)
monsters.description: The most numerous race in the Palladium world. Their ambition and adaptability allow them to excel in every O.C.C.

monsters.name: Elf
abilities: Acute senses (+10% prowl, track, detect phases)
monsters.magicAbilities: Per O.C.C. (many pursue wizardry or warlock paths)
monsters.description: Graceful, long-lived folk renowned for magic, archery, and ancient culture.

monsters.name: Dwarf
abilities: Resistant to magic (+2 save vs spells)
monsters.magicAbilities: Per O.C.C. (few pursue wizardry, many become men of arms)
monsters.description: Stout craftsmen and warriors who dwell in mountain strongholds and value honor and craftsmanship.

monsters.name: Gnome
monsters.psionics: Standard (per individual; 20% chance for minor senses)
monsters.description: Small, clever folk who blend curiosity with craftsmanship. Many live alongside dwarven clans.

monsters.name: Ogre (Civilized)
monsters.description: Crude but potentially trainable giants who sometimes integrate into mixed monster communities.

monsters.name: Troll (Regenerating)
monsters.description: Towering humanoids who rely on rapid regeneration and brute force. Some become mercenaries or shock troops.

monsters.name: Orc
abilities: Enemies humans and elves; relentless border raiders
monsters.description: Strong, aggressive humanoids with greenish skin and tusks. They form large armies, practice brutal religions through shamans or witches, and frequently war with humans and elves.

monsters.name: Kobold
monsters.description: Small, reptilian humanoids with scaly skin. They are cowardly but cunning, known for burrowing lairs, setting traps, and ambushes, but they are uncomfortable in sunlight.

monsters.name: Wolfen
abilities: Pack discipline grants +2 initiative when fighting with other Wolfen
monsters.description: Wolf-like humanoids with fur, pointed ears, and fangs. They are fierce warriors who fight in organized packs and often follow strict codes of honor.

monsters.name: Changeling
abilities: Cannot duplicate magical powers or auras
monsters.description: Mysterious humanoids capable of perfect shape-shifting. They infiltrate human settlements by disguising themselves as trusted individuals, though they cannot mimic the powers or aura of magical beings.

monsters.name: Troglodyte
monsters.description: Broad-shouldered subterranean humanoids with pale skin and large dark eyes. They worship elemental or nymph deities and rarely venture above ground.

monsters.name: Lycanthrope (Generic Template)
monsters.description: Base template for lycanthropes. Human/elf/dwarf/etc. by day; transforms into wolf, bear, tiger, or panther at night. Use specific were-beast entries (werewolf, weretiger, werepanther, werebear) for detailed stats.
monsters.notes: This is a generic template. Use specific were-beast entries for detailed stats.

monsters.name: Water Elemental (Minor)
abilities: Bio-regenerates 2d6 S.D.C. per melee while submerged
Can command aquatic animals within 200 ft (60% chance)
monsters.description: Living water spirits that can drown victims and blast with pressurized water. Serve Water Warlocks as scouts and guardians.

monsters.name: Water Elemental (Major)
abilities: Bio-regenerates 4d6 S.D.C. per melee while submerged
Can command aquatic animals within 400 ft (80% chance)
monsters.description: Powerful water spirits capable of creating tidal waves and massive whirlpools. Often guard dimensional rifts beneath the sea.

monsters.name: Fire Elemental (Minor)
abilities: Bio-regenerates 2d6 S.D.C. per melee while in flames
Can teleport through connected flames (60 ft range)
monsters.description: Living flames that burn everything they touch and can hurl fireballs. Serve Fire Warlocks or appear near great infernos.

monsters.name: Fire Elemental (Major)
abilities: Bio-regenerates 4d6 S.D.C. per melee in flames
Teleport through connected flames (180 ft range)
monsters.description: Massive fire spirits capable of creating devastating firestorms and infernos. Only obey powerful magic circles or Fire Lords.

monsters.name: Air Elemental (Minor)
abilities: Bio-regenerates 2d6 S.D.C. per melee while within strong winds
Half damage from physical attacks unless magic or psionic
Can suffocate foes (save vs magic or no actions for 1 melee)
monsters.description: Living wind spirits that can create tornadoes and become invisible in air. Summoned by Air Warlocks to scout or harry foes.

monsters.name: Air Elemental (Major)
abilities: Bio-regenerates 4d6 S.D.C. per melee within storms
Half damage from physical attacks unless magic or psionic
Can hurl lightning bolts (4d6, counts as spell)
monsters.description: Powerful wind spirits capable of creating hurricanes and massive tornadoes. Treat mortals with aloof indifference unless bound.

monsters.name: Earth Elemental (Minor)
abilities: Bio-regenerates 3d6 S.D.C. per melee while in contact with stone
Half damage from fire and cold
monsters.description: Living rock spirits that are slow but incredibly strong and durable. Often used as guardians for ancient tombs.

monsters.name: Earth Elemental (Major)
abilities: Bio-regenerates 5d6 S.D.C. per melee while in contact with stone
Half damage from fire and cold
monsters.description: Massive earth spirits capable of creating earthquakes and throwing boulders. Frequently guard ley line nexuses or ancient vaults.

monsters.name: Mud Mound (Earth Elemental Variant)
abilities: Amorphous body; half damage from physical attacks unless magic or fire
Bio-regenerates 3d6 S.D.C. per melee while in mud or swamp
Quicksand aura (30 ft): save vs magic or sink 1-4 feet per melee
Can hurl mud globes (2d6, blinds target on failed save)
monsters.description: Semi-liquid earth elementals that lurk in swamps and river deltas. They drag intruders beneath the mire and smother them in mud.

monsters.name: Ice Elemental
abilities: Bio-regenerates 2d6 S.D.C. per melee in freezing conditions
Half damage from physical attacks unless magic or flaming
Aura of frost (10 ft): save vs magic or -2 strike/parry/dodge
monsters.description: Living ice spirits that freeze everything they touch and create blizzards. Serve winter gods or powerful Water Warlocks.

monsters.name: Gargoyle
monsters.description: Stone-winged creatures that can turn to stone and blend with architecture.

monsters.name: Gargoyle Mage
monsters.description: Intelligent gargoyles capable of casting spells and leading others of their kind.

monsters.name: Vampire
monsters.description: Undead creatures that feed on blood and can transform into mist or bats.

monsters.name: Banshee
abilities: Resistant to heat and cold (half damage)
Cry creates emotional turmoil: moaning (fear), weeping (despair), wail (devastating)
monsters.description: Appears as an old, veiled woman in an eerie white glow. Her cry can cause terror, despair, and even suicidal tendencies in those who hear it. Symbol of hopelessness, despair, and death.

monsters.name: Succubus/Incubus
monsters.description: The succubus (female) and incubus (male) appear as extremely attractive people (P.B. 20) to lure the unsuspecting to their doom. Harbingers of death, they attract, seduce, and charm before slaying. Psychotic killers.

monsters.name: Kukulcan
abilities: Magic: All air elemental magic levels 1-6
monsters.description: Also known as the bird serpent; a symbol of light. Gentle and peaceful, often takes on a human guise to aid or protect good creatures. Extremely rare—fewer than a hundred exist worldwide.

monsters.name: Gargoylite
monsters.description: Smaller, weaker relatives of gargoyles. Less intelligent but still dangerous in groups.

monsters.name: Gurgoyle
monsters.description: Dark green or grey-green skin, blazing yellow eyes. Gurgoyles do not have wings but are just as numerous and nearly as dangerous as gargoyles.

monsters.name: The Couril
abilities: Forces creatures to dance through song (save negates)
Magic: Cloud of slumber, tongues, fleet feet, speed of the snail, ventriloquism
monsters.description: Little demons resembling faeries but slightly taller and darker. They compel their victims to dance uncontrollably through their song, often followed by physical assault with thrown objects.

monsters.name: Ghoul and Nasu
monsters.description: Small, gnarled demons resembling humans that haunt graveyards and battlefields. They scavenge on corpses and rarely attack the living unless provoked by overwhelming numbers or commanded by a higher demon.

monsters.name: Thelasae
monsters.description: Tiny, insect-like demons with sharp barbs on their forearms, sides of the hands, shoulders, knees, and lower legs. Cruel creatures that relish maiming and torturing their victims.

monsters.name: The Shedim
abilities: Head of a hawk, two hawk-like claws
monsters.description: Demonic minions with the head of a hawk and two fierce, hawk-like claws. Despite lacking wings, they serve as relentless pawns for greater demons, lords, and gods. Attack savagely and unceasingly until defeated or commanded to cease.

monsters.name: Cheetah
monsters.description: Fastest land animal, capable of incredible bursts of speed. Found in southern grasslands, particularly common in the Land of the South Winds.

monsters.name: Domestic Cat
monsters.description: Common household pet found worldwide. Independent and agile.

monsters.name: Wild Dog
monsters.description: Wild canines found worldwide, traveling in territorial packs.

monsters.name: Domestic Dog
abilities: Relentless pursuit when following a fresh scent
monsters.description: Trained hunting and companion dogs. Retrievers, spaniels, setters, and pointers.

monsters.name: Work Dog
abilities: Carry loads or pull sleds with minimal fatigue
monsters.description: Large working dogs used for guarding, herding, and heavy labor.

monsters.name: Fox
abilities: Excellent hearing; can detect predators 300 ft away
monsters.description: Cunning small canines found in red, grey, and silver varieties. Red fox in east and north; grey and silver in west, east, and Old Kingdom.

monsters.name: Northern Timber Wolf
abilities: Communicate via howls up to 5 miles
monsters.description: Large, powerful wolves found in the Northern Wilderness. Travel in packs and defend large territories.

monsters.name: Hyena
abilities: Bone-crushing jaws (counts as crush attack vs small prey)
monsters.description: Scavenging pack animals with powerful jaws. Found in southern regions.

monsters.name: War Horse
abilities: Can pull up to five tons
Battle trained; saves vs Horror +2 when ridden by trusted rider
monsters.description: Large, powerful horses bred for battle. Highly valued and expensive.

monsters.name: Race Horse
abilities: Skittish in combat unless morale tested
monsters.description: Fastest horses, bred for speed and endurance. Extremely valuable.

monsters.name: Jumper and Riding Horse
monsters.description: Versatile horses used for riding and jumping. Most common type.

monsters.name: Work Horse
abilities: Can pull up to four tons
Pair in tandem: up to fifteen tons
Docile temperament; +2 save vs Horror when within stable herd
monsters.description: Heavy draft horses used for farm work and pulling loads.

monsters.name: Pony
abilities: Remarkably hardy; can survive on sparse forage
monsters.description: Small, hardy horses suitable for children and light work.

monsters.name: Donkey
monsters.description: Sturdy pack animals known for their endurance and stubbornness.

monsters.name: Mouse
abilities: Excellent hearing; alert others to danger
monsters.description: Small rodents found everywhere. Common pests but generally harmless.

monsters.name: Squirrel
abilities: Can leap between trees up to 10 ft apart
monsters.description: Arboreal rodents known for climbing and hoarding nuts.

monsters.name: Raccoon
monsters.description: Clever, dexterous mammals with distinctive masks. Excellent climbers and swimmers.

monsters.name: Weasel
abilities: Squeeze through openings as small as two inches
monsters.description: Small, ferocious predators. Excellent hunters despite their size.

monsters.name: Mink
abilities: Can remain underwater for two minutes
monsters.description: Semi-aquatic mustelids with valuable fur. Excellent swimmers.

monsters.name: Badger
abilities: Ferocious when cornered (+2 save vs Horror, +2 damage for 1 melee)
monsters.description: Fierce burrowing mammals. Aggressive when cornered.

monsters.name: Otter
abilities: Playful nature; +10% to animal training checks
monsters.description: Playful aquatic mammals. Excellent swimmers and divers.

monsters.name: Deer
monsters.description: Graceful herbivores found worldwide. Stags have antlers.

monsters.name: Wild Pig
abilities: Charge attack +2 strike against surprised foes
monsters.description: Feral pigs found in south, west, and east. Dangerous when cornered.

monsters.name: Alinite Wild Boar
abilities: Charge for double damage once per melee
monsters.description: Massive wild boars found in southern jungles. Extremely dangerous and aggressive.

monsters.name: Giant Timber Spider
abilities: Poison: Causes swelling, fever, nausea; -1 strike, -2 dodge, -1 parry (cumulative); lasts 24 hours
monsters.description: Large spiders found in northern and eastern forests. Poisonous bite causes debilitating effects.

monsters.name: Corinth Cave Spider
monsters.description: Small but deadly spiders found in mountains and caves. Extremely venomous despite size.

monsters.name: Giant Cave Spider
abilities: Poison: 2d6 damage; causes dizziness and nausea; -2 strike/parry/dodge; takes effect in 3 melees, lasts 1-4 melees
monsters.description: Large spiders found in mountains and caves of the south and Old Kingdom. Potent venom.

monsters.name: Black Leaper
abilities: Leap 1-4 feet per jump (up to 6 jumps per melee)
Poison: Deadliest in world; 6d6 damage; takes effect in 3 melees; -4 strike, -5 parry/dodge, -6 initiative; lasts 12 hours
monsters.description: Tiny but incredibly deadly spiders. Their poison is the deadliest in the world. Favored by alchemists and assassins. Found in east, south, and west (never in mountains).

monsters.name: The Cherubs
abilities: Magic: All levels 1-5 air elemental magic
monsters.description: An infant with feathered wings and eyes of yellow flame. Celestial beings of air magic.

monsters.name: Ariel
abilities: Magic: All levels 1-5 earth elemental magic
monsters.description: Perhaps the most bizarre of the four angels, the Ariel has two human heads, the body of a lion, the wings of an angel, and the tail of a serpent.

monsters.name: Seraph
abilities: Magic: All levels 1-5 fire elemental magic
monsters.description: Appears as a beautiful woman with wings of an angel. Celestial being of fire magic.

monsters.name: Tharsis
abilities: Magic: All levels 1-5 water elemental magic
monsters.description: Also known as 'the Avenging Angel' and 'wingless angel.' Gentle creatures who abhor unnecessary violence, seeking out and eliminating evil. Resembles a beautiful golden sea horse of great stature.

monsters.name: Alu
monsters.description: Lesser demons found throughout the world. Common foot soldiers of demonic armies.

monsters.name: Aquatics
monsters.description: Sea demons with the appearance of both octopus and fish. Specialize in dragging victims underwater to drown them. Known for capsizing small boats.

monsters.name: Baal-Rog
monsters.magicAbilities: All fire elemental spells (levels 1-4) plus Fire Whip (level 7) at 5th-level proficiency
monsters.description: Huge red-brown muscular demons with flaming red eyes and massive black bat wings. Symbols of cunning and power, they covet magic scrolls, items, wealth, and power, and are usually loners.

monsters.name: Demon Locusts
monsters.description: Swarming demonic insects. Attack in massive numbers, overwhelming victims.

monsters.name: Gallu the Demon Bull
monsters.description: Massive demonic bulls with powerful horns. Charge attacks are devastating.

monsters.name: The Jinn
monsters.description: Powerful shape-shifting demons. Known for granting wishes, but always with a twist or negative consequence.

monsters.name: Magot
abilities: Eye beams petrify victims (save vs. magic 12+, duration 20 minutes)
monsters.description: Hideous giant maws mounted on three thick legs, with three long tentacle-like eyestalks. Magots are powerful demons native to Hades. They roam in herds in Hell, petrifying and devouring the living and the dead alike. Rarely are more than one or two encountered outside of Hades. They serve Mictla the Devourer, a greater demonic power.

monsters.name: Jungle Kodiak
abilities: Jungle adaptation: +2 prowl in dense vegetation
monsters.description: Massive kodiak bears adapted to jungle environments. Larger and more aggressive than their northern cousins. Found in southern jungles.

dragons.name: Fire Dragon
dragons.description: Dragons in shades of red from scarlet to alizarin, with massive wings and powerful limbs. Prolific in magic use and study, preferring warm climates.

dragons.name: Ice Dragon
dragons.description: Dragons of any shade of blue or white; famed for their great magic and military leadership. Found primarily in the north, often seen in winter on the tundra of the Ophids Grasslands.

dragons.name: Night Stalker
dragons.description: Dull green, grey, or black with large watery blue eyes, long serpentine body, powerful wings, and terrible claws. Symbol of darkness and the undead. Found throughout the world, particularly in mountainous areas and the Old Kingdom.

dragons.name: Great Horned Dragon
dragons.size: 70–90 ft long; colossal horns and crest
special_abilities: Impervious to fire; half damage from cold

dragons.name: Mighty Wooly Dragon
dragons.size: 60–80 ft long; shaggy fur between plates
special_abilities: Impervious to cold/ice; half damage from fire
Snow burrow (move through drifts without penalty)

dragons.name: Sea Dragon
dragons.size: 55–85 ft long; finned crest, webbed claws

dragons.name: Serpent of the Wind
special_abilities: Extremely agile flyers despite wingless form
